title: There Is a Word or Several, Must Be – Comprehension Questions (Band 4)
author: Kathleen Spivak
poem:
There Is a Word or Several, Must Be – Kathleen Spivak

Breathe these words in all languages before they’re lost, thank you and mean it. The things we take for granted and now have abandoned us. Or will. Water, air, rich earth beneath the rubble, thank you for our daily breath. Give us this day. Exhale the little thank you words, they’re quick, slip out of our pores, clean hair. A shower. Soap and aspirin. Thank you. Whoever “you” might be. Appreciation. A survival skill we never get to hone enough. Thank you, For life. For health, for the newborn baby slipping out between the hips. For wondrous eyes and little rosebud fists, thank you, sweet pea. And jump ropes, patience, teachers of the world, and teach me self-control. Migration, vanishing, the butterflies, the orange peach of the oriole. Whatever bright-eyed bird you once saw flicker past and wondered what was that? You were lucky to have it show itself. You are lucky perhaps to be it, plumage, proud breast and wings. Thank you for shelter, the blanket of morning. Of this morning. When first frost found naked earth, or when you found that one shade tree in the desert of last summer. Sun like a knife blade, now the reluctant release of pain, those precious moments when it goes away. Do you still remember having such moments? There is a word or several, must be, in all the language, for saying thank you in a world of swirl. Thank you for not yet abandoning me, my body. Wait a bit. Yes please.

questions.question: What is the main theme of Kathleen Spivak’s poem?
options: The importance of saying thank you and gratitude
The celebration of wealth and power
questions.answer: The importance of saying thank you and gratitude

questions.question: In the line 'Breathe these words in all languages before they’re lost,' what is the poet warning about?
options: The disappearance of languages and gratitude
People learning new words too fast
questions.answer: The disappearance of languages and gratitude

questions.question: The repeated phrase 'thank you' creates what effect in the poem?
options: A feeling of anger and disappointment
A sense of rhythm and appreciation
A focus on confusion and loss
questions.answer: A sense of rhythm and appreciation

questions.question: What does the poet mean by 'Appreciation. A survival skill we never get to hone enough'?
options: Survival depends only on physical strength
Being thankful helps people endure hardship
Appreciation is only for wealthy people
questions.answer: Being thankful helps people endure hardship

questions.question: The mention of 'Water, air, rich earth' represents:
options: The basic elements of life we often take for granted
questions.answer: The basic elements of life we often take for granted

The image of 'the orange peach of the oriole' is an example of:
The line 'Sun like a knife blade' uses which poetic technique?
What emotion is expressed in the final lines 'Thank you for not yet abandoning me, my body'?
options: Fear of death and gratitude for life
questions.answer: Fear of death and gratitude for life
